control.control_title: Information Security Awareness, Education and Training
control.control_purpose: To ensure personnel understand their information security responsibilities and can perform their role securely
control.control_objective: Provide appropriate information security awareness, education, and training to personnel and relevant interested parties with regular updates on information security policies and procedures

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Personnel of the organisation and relevant interested parties should receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organisation's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
key_requirements: Regular updates provided on security policies
Regular updates provided on topic-specific procedures

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive control building security awareness and competence across organization
scope: Secure use of systems and technologies
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Personnel understand security responsibilities and implement secure practices in daily work

prerequisites.description: Before implementing awareness and training, foundational elements must be in place

required_prerequisites.rationale: Training must be based on documented organizational policies

required_prerequisites.description: Documented policies for specific security areas (access control, incident management, data protection, etc.)
required_prerequisites.rationale: Personnel need understanding of policies relevant to their roles
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security

required_prerequisites.description: Documented procedures for key security processes
required_prerequisites.rationale: Training content must cover how to follow procedures
required_prerequisites.reference: All Annex A controls with implementation procedures

required_prerequisites.rationale: Informs training priorities and target audience needs
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.2 - Information security risk assessment

iseat_program_overview.definition: Comprehensive program to develop personnel competence and awareness in information security through planned education, training, and ongoing communication

awareness.definition: Understanding of security threats, responsibilities, and importance

education.definition: Structured learning about security concepts, principles, and best practices

training.definition: Practical skills development for implementing secure practices

target_audiences: Third parties and suppliers with system access

implementation_requirements.requirement: Define Training Needs Based on Risk
implementation_requirements.description: Conduct training needs analysis to identify what training is required

analysis_elements: Identify security risks relevant to organization
Map risks to roles and responsibilities
details.output: Training needs matrix by role and audience

implementation_requirements.requirement: Develop Information Security Awareness and Training Plan
implementation_requirements.description: Create documented plan covering awareness and training activities

annual_components: Annual information security awareness training for all
Initial onboarding training for new hires

implementation_requirements.description: Create appropriate training materials covering required topics

content_topics: Leadership and management commitment to security
How to report incidents and events
Secure use of systems and technologies
details.best_practice: Use variety of methods to engage different learning styles

implementation_requirements.description: Provide security training as part of new hire process

details.timing: Pre-employment or during onboarding before system access

implementation_requirements.description: Provide annual security awareness training to all personnel

details.frequency: At least annually for all personnel

implementation_requirements.description: Provide annual data protection and privacy training
Deliver training tailored to specific job functions and responsibilities

target_groups: IT and system administrators - detailed technical security controls
Information security personnel - advanced security topics
Finance and accounting - financial data protection
Operations - physical security and access control
Customer-facing roles - data privacy and customer information
Management - security governance and risk management
details.approach: Training content and depth tailored to role and responsibilities

implementation_requirements.description: Maintain ongoing security awareness through regular communications and campaigns
Train personnel when significant changes to policies or systems occur

details.training_approach: Targeted training on changed elements delivered promptly

implementation_requirements.description: Assess that personnel have understood and retained training content

details.assessment: Tests or assessments built into training modules
details.pass_requirement: Personnel must demonstrate understanding before completion
details.follow_up: Additional training provided where understanding is not demonstrated

implementation_requirements.description: Document all training and awareness activities

details.retention: Keep records for appropriate period (typically 3+ years)
details.accessibility: Records must be retrievable for audit purposes

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure personnel know about and understand training requirements
Ensure training covers consequences of not following security policies

details.purpose: Reinforce importance of compliance and secure behavior

implementation_requirements.description: Consider using off-the-shelf or specialized training platforms

details.alternative: Manual training process if specialized tools not available

implementation_requirements.description: Regularly review and improve training program effectiveness

improvement_actions: Increase frequency or intensity if needed
Add new topics if gaps identified
Remove or minimize less relevant content

Create documented plan covering all required elements

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 6.3

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with awareness and training

mistakes.mistake: No documented evidence that training actually happened
mistakes.description: Training conducted informally without records or documentation
mistakes.impact: Cannot demonstrate compliance, audit failures, no proof training was delivered or understood
mistakes.audit_gotcha: If training isn't documented, auditors will consider it not done

mistakes.mistake: Team members haven't completed required training
mistakes.description: Not all personnel complete annual training or new hire training
mistakes.impact: Non-compliant personnel, higher security risk, audit finding, potential breach
mistakes.best_practice: Verify 100% completion of mandatory training before audit

mistakes.mistake: Document version control and maintenance issues
mistakes.description: Training materials and plan not current, outdated policy versions used
mistakes.impact: Personnel trained on outdated policies, inconsistent understanding, compliance issues
prevention: Remove draft comments from final versions

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 6.3 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify documented awareness and training program exists
checks: Plan identifies target audiences and roles
Plan describes training content and topics
Plan covers policy updates and changes

audit_areas.description: Verify training needs assessed and documented
Verify training actually delivered to personnel
checks: Onboarding training for new hires conducted
Training delivered to relevant interested parties
audit_areas.biggest_gotcha: Personnel with no training records or incomplete training

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, personnel security awareness and competence is critical to protecting customer funds, game integrity, and regulatory compliance

training_requirements: Personnel with RNG access trained on integrity requirements
Training on tampering prevention and detection
Training on audit logging and monitoring
Data protection and privacy training for all personnel handling customer data
PCI DSS requirements for payment card data
Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements
Problem gambling and responsible gambling procedures

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must demonstrate comprehensive awareness, education, and training program ensuring all personnel understand security responsibilities for protecting customer funds, game integrity, and compliance with UKGC requirements

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Build organizational security competence and culture through systematic awareness, education, and training aligned with organizational risks and regulatory requirements
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - personnel are often the weakest security link; effective training reduces security incidents and ensures compliance
key_principles: Training needs driven by risk assessment
Documented plan covering all required topics
Appropriate for job function and responsibility
Initial onboarding training before system access
Annual refresher training for all personnel

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 6.3 Information Security Awareness, Education, and Training, implement

requirements.detail: Identify training requirements by role and risk
Document awareness and training plan signed off and implemented
Develop or acquire training materials covering required topics
Train all new hires before system access
Annual security awareness and data protection training
Targeted training for critical roles and functions
Testing or assessment verifying personnel understanding
Complete records of all training and completion
Personnel aware of training requirements and schedule
Annual review of program and continuous improvement

planning_best_practices: Base training plan on documented risk assessment and needs analysis
Include all required topics: policies, procedures, responsibilities, incident reporting
Plan for annual awareness training plus regular updates
Use combination of online and classroom methods
Consider off-the-shelf training platforms for efficiency
delivery_best_practices: Make training engaging and relevant to roles
Use variety of delivery methods for different learning styles
Provide training before system access for new hires
Use professional training materials or certified trainers
Conduct simulated phishing campaigns for awareness
Use real incidents and case studies as teaching examples
Keep training current with emerging threats
engagement_best_practices: Make consequences clear for policy violations
assessment_best_practices: Use multiple question types and formats
Provide remedial training for those not passing
Use assessments to identify knowledge gaps
record_keeping_best_practices: Track by person: name, role, training received, date, result
compliance_best_practices: Keep version control of training materials
Document policy changes that trigger training
Track follow-up actions on identified gaps

critical_training_areas.training_focus: Personnel with access to RNG or game systems must understand integrity requirements, tampering prevention, audit logging, and investigation procedures
All personnel must understand data protection principles; those handling customer data need detailed training on classification, access control, and breach notification
Personnel involved in compliance must understand UKGC requirements for AML/KYC, problem gambling identification, license compliance, and reporting
All personnel must know how to identify and report incidents; management must understand investigation and notification procedures

regulatory_expectations: Comprehensive awareness program addressing gaming-specific risks
Documented evidence of annual training completion for all personnel
RNG and game integrity training for relevant technical staff
Data protection training for personnel handling customer information
Compliance training on AML/KYC and problem gambling procedures
audit_readiness: Prepare sample training materials for auditor review
Document training needs analysis specific to gambling operations
Track completion dates within 30 days of fiscal year start
Show assessment results and follow-up actions
